page.title: 02SOUTH BEDFORD :2
page.content:
The two railways into the town crossed the block and attracted a number of industrial companies to build factories with sidings on to the main lines. Most of these factory premises are still in existence although their reliance on the railway is very small nowadays.
The development along Elstow Road was later, most being in the 1930's but again there were industrial premises with connections with the railway.
The majority of industrial work in the area is light engineering although there is a chocolate factory owned by Tobler Suchard.
